metadata.titleEn: Dataset of Heihe integrated observatory network: automatic weather station of Heihe remote sensing station, 2022
metadata.titleCn: 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网：黑河遥感站自动气象站（2022）
metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Heihe integrated observatory network obtained from the automatic weather station (AWS) at the observation system of Heihe remote sensing station from January 1 to December 31, 2022. The site (100.4756° E, 38.8270° N) was located on artificial grassland in Dangzhai Town of Zhangye, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1560 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (1.5 m, north), wind speed and direction (10 m, north), air pressure (2 m), rain gauge (0.7 m), four-component radiometer (1.5 m, south), two infrared temperature sensors (1.5 m, south, vertically downward), soil heat flux (3 duplicates, -0.06 m), soil temperature profile (0, -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.8, -1.2, -1.6 m), soil moisture profile (-0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.8, -1.2, -1.6 m), and two photosynthetically active radiation (1.5 m, south, one vertically downward and one vertically upward).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_1.5, RH_1.5 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_10 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_10 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, and Gs_3) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_2 cm, Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, Ts_20 cm, Ts_40 cm, Ts_80 cm, Ts_120 cm, Ts_160 cm) (℃), soil moisture (Ms_2 cm, Ms_4 cm, Ms_10 cm, Ms_20 cm, Ms_40 cm, Ms_80 cm, Ms_120 cm, Ms_160 cm) (℃),on the plants photosynthetically active radiation of upward and downward (PAR_U_up and PAR_U_down) (μmol/ (s m2)).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. The missing data were denoted by -6999. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2022-6-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2022年1月1日至2022年12月31日黑河流域地表过程综合观测网中游黑河遥感站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市党寨镇东侧，下垫面是人工草地。观测点的经纬度是100.4756E, 38.8270N，海拔1560m。空气温度湿度传感器架设在1.5m处，朝向正北；气压计在防水箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在0.7 m处；风速风向传感器架设在10m处，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装高度为1.5m，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装高度为1.5m，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处；土壤水分探头埋设在2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处；平均土壤温度探头埋设在2cm和4cm；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处；两个光合有效辐射仪分别架设在冠层上方1.5m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个），朝向正南。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_1.5m、RH_1.5m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：%)、向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_U_up、PAR_U_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)、平均土壤温度（TCAV）（单位：摄氏度）。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2022-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称
黑河综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时还包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Are the data collection methods in the field primarily based on automatic weather stations, eddy covariance systems, or scintillometers?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 该领域的数据收集方法主要基于自动气象站、涡度协方差系统或闪烁仪吗？
Disjunctive.AnswerEn: automatic weather stations, eddy covariance systems, scintillometers
Disjunctive.AnswerCn: 自动气象站、涡度相关系统、闪烁仪

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What data collection methods are used to gather information on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，收集有关能量、水蒸气和碳交换的信息的方法有哪些？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: field and remote-sensing observations, numerical simulations, eddy covariance systems, scintillometers
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 现场和遥感观测、数值模拟、涡度相关系统、闪烁仪

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to observe soil temperature and moisture profiles in arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于观察干旱地区土壤温度和湿度剖面的数据收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: In the Heihe River Basin, soil temperature and moisture profiles are observed using soil temperature and moisture probes buried at various depths, such as 0cm, 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm, and 160cm, as part of an automatic weather station setup.
Example.AnswerCn: 在黑河流域，使用埋在不同深度的土壤温度和湿度探头（如0cm、2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm和160cm）观察土壤温度和湿度剖面，作为自动气象站设置的一部分。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced when collecting hydrometeorological data in oasis–desert systems?
Example.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集水文气象数据时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: One challenge faced in collecting hydrometeorological data in oasis–desert systems is the ecological environment degradation, such as drying up of rivers, degradation of vegetation, and land desertification, especially in inland river basins along the Silk Road.
Example.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集水文气象数据面临的一个挑战是生态环境退化，例如河流干涸、植被退化和土地沙漠化，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的内陆河流流域。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of a dataset containing long-term energy and carbon flux observations in arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个包含干旱地区长期能源和碳通量观测的数据集示例？
Example.AnswerEn: A dataset containing long-term energy and carbon flux observations is available from the middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin, which includes data from 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations established since 2012, capturing energy, water vapor, carbon fluxes, and additional hydrometeorological data.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个包含长期能源和碳通量观测的数据集可从黑河流域的中下游地区获得，该数据集包括自2012年以来建立的11个地表通量和气象站的数据，捕捉了能源、水蒸气、碳通量以及其他水文气象数据。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics and methods of quality control applied to meteorological data collected in arid and semiarid regions?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区收集的气象数据的质量控制特征和方法是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: specific number of data points per day, placeholder for missing data, removal of duplicate records, elimination of data exceeding physical or instrumental limits, marking uncertain data, standardized date and time formats
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 每天的特定数据点数量，缺失数据的占位符，删除重复记录，消除超过物理或仪器限制的数据，标记不确定数据，标准化日期和时间格式。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What attributes are essential for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 理解绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的基本属性有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: long-term observations of energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes, hydrometeorological parameters, vegetation, soil parameters
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 能量、水汽、碳和甲烷通量、水文气象参数、植被和土壤参数的长期观测。

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many meteorological stations have been established in the arid regions of western China since 2012 for observing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自2012年以来，在中国西部的干旱地区建立了多少个气象站，用于观察能量、水汽和碳交换？

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the frequency of data collection for the automatic weather stations observing hydrometeorological parameters in the oasis–desert systems?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，自动气象站观察水文气象参数的数据收集频率是多少？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How long is the period covered by the observational datasets of energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes in oasis–desert systems?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的观测数据集覆盖的时间周期是多长？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the role of an oasis in the context of arid and semi-arid regions and their ecological systems?
Definition.QuestionCn: 绿洲在干旱和半干旱地区及其生态系统中的作用是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that not only forms the core of regions’ ecological environment but also underpins their economic development. In China's arid regions, oases, which constitute less than 10% of the total area, support more than 90% of the population. They are crucial for maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity within the oasis-desert system.
Definition.AnswerCn: 绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅构成了区域生态环境的核心，还支撑着经济发展。在中国的干旱地区，绿洲占总面积的不到10%，却支持着90%以上的人口。它们对于维持绿洲-沙漠系统内稳定的生态环境和农业生产力至关重要。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are the typical components included in a dataset for studying oasis–desert interactions?
Definition.QuestionCn: 研究绿洲与沙漠相互作用的典型数据集组件包括哪些？
Definition.AnswerEn: A typical dataset for studying oasis–desert interactions includes long-term energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, along with auxiliary data on hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters. This encompasses data such as radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, soil moisture profiles, and groundwater table data.
Definition.AnswerCn: 一个典型的用于研究绿洲-沙漠相互作用的数据集包括长期的能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及关于水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。这些数据包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水、土壤湿度剖面和地下水位数据。

Definition.QuestionEn: What challenges do inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face in terms of ecological environment degradation?
Definition.QuestionCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临的生态环境退化挑战有哪些？
Definition.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face challenges like the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These issues are particularly prevalent in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin, the Aral Sea basin, and the Lake Urmia basin.
Definition.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临着诸多挑战，如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些问题在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域中尤为突出，例如塔里木河流域、阿拉尔海流域和乌尔米湖流域。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the methodologies used in data collection from automatic weather stations contribute to understanding the interactions between energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 自动气象站的数据收集方法如何有助于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换之间的相互作用？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The methodologies used in data collection, such as using automatic weather stations to gather hydrometeorological data and eddy covariance systems for flux data, allow for a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange. This is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development in these areas.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 数据收集中使用的方法，如自动气象站收集水文气象数据和涡度协方差系统获取通量数据，使我们能够定量理解能量、水蒸气和碳的交换。这对于认识绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用以及支持这些地区的生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What are the potential implications of using long-term observational datasets from oasis–desert systems for understanding global carbon cycles?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 使用来自绿洲-沙漠系统的长期观测数据集对理解全球碳循环的潜在影响是什么？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Using long-term observational datasets from oasis–desert systems can provide insights into these areas as carbon sinks, which significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions. This understanding is increasingly important in the context of the global carbon cycle and achieving goals related to carbon peaking and neutrality.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 利用来自绿洲-沙漠系统的长期观测数据集，可以深入了解这些地区作为碳汇的作用，这对干旱地区的碳平衡产生重要影响。在全球碳循环以及实现碳达峰和碳中和目标的背景下，这种理解变得愈发重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it crucial to include both artificial and natural oasis–desert systems when collecting datasets for energy and carbon exchange studies?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在收集能源和碳交换研究的数据集时，包含人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统是至关重要的。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Including both artificial and natural oasis–desert systems is crucial because it provides a comprehensive understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in different types of ecosystems, which is essential for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and ensuring ecological stability and sustainable development.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 包括人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统是至关重要的，因为这提供了对不同类型生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的全面理解，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用以及确保生态稳定和可持续发展是必不可少的。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the reasons behind the deployment of multiple land surface flux and meteorological stations in the Heihe River Basin for data collection?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域部署多个地表通量和气象站进行数据收集的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Multiple stations are deployed to capture the spatial variability and complex interactions of hydrometeorological factors, energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes across diverse conditions in the middle and lower reaches of the arid regions, which are influenced by the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 多个站点被部署以捕捉干旱地区中下游不同条件下水文气象因素、能量、水汽和碳通量的空间变异性和复杂相互作用，这些地区受到上游典型冰冻圈的影响。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What could be the consequences of implementing strict data quality control measures on the reliability of meteorological datasets collected in arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区实施严格的数据质量控制措施可能对气象数据集的可靠性产生哪些后果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing strict data quality control measures can enhance the reliability of meteorological datasets by ensuring completeness and accuracy, as seen in the methodology where missing data is flagged, duplicates are removed, and data exceeding physical or instrumental limits is discarded.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 实施严格的数据质量控制措施可以通过确保数据的完整性和准确性来增强气象数据集的可靠性，正如在方法中所示，缺失的数据会被标记，重复的数据会被删除，超出物理或仪器限制的数据会被丢弃。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the integration of long-term observational datasets affect the understanding of carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据集的整合如何影响对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中碳交换的理解？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The integration of long-term observational datasets can significantly improve the understanding of carbon exchange by providing comprehensive data on energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes over time, which is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集的整合可以显著提高对碳交换的理解，因为它提供了关于能量、水蒸气和碳通量的综合数据，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及支持生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential implications of using automated weather stations for collecting high-frequency data in remote or arid areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在偏远或干旱地区使用自动气象站收集高频数据的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using automated weather stations for high-frequency data collection in remote or arid areas allows for continuous monitoring of meteorological parameters, which can result in a detailed understanding of environmental processes, as demonstrated by the 10-minute interval data collection and subsequent data processing and quality control.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用自动气象站在偏远或干旱地区进行高频数据收集，可以实现对气象参数的连续监测，从而深入了解环境过程，这通过10分钟间隔的数据收集以及随后的数据处理和质量控制得以体现。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the main objectives of collecting long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 收集绿洲-沙漠生态系统中长期能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The main objectives include achieving a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas to recognize interactions, protect ecological stability, support socioeconomic development, and contribute to carbon peaking and carbon neutrality goals.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标包括实现对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，以识别相互作用，保护生态稳定，支持社会经济发展，并为碳达峰和碳中和目标做出贡献。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to maintain a comprehensive observation network in arid and semiarid regions, such as the Heihe River Basin?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区（如黑河流域）维护一个全面的观测网络是非常重要的，原因如下：
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is important to maintain a comprehensive observation network to study the complex interactions within oasis–desert systems, address ecological challenges like land degradation and desertification, and support sustainable development and ecological security in these regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 维护一个全面的观察网络对于研究绿洲-沙漠系统内复杂的相互作用、应对土地退化和沙漠化等生态挑战，以及支持这些地区的可持续发展和生态安全至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the procedures for ensuring data quality and handling missing data in meteorological observations within arid and semi-arid ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保干旱和半干旱生态系统中气象观测数据质量和处理缺失数据的程序是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data quality is ensured by verifying the presence of the expected number of daily data points, specifically 144 per day, due to 10-minute intervals. Missing data are marked with -6999, duplicate records are removed, and data that exceed physical or instrumental limits are deleted. Problematic data are highlighted in red, and consistent formatting for date and time is maintained.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据质量通过验证每天预期的数据点数量来确保，具体为每天144个数据点，因为数据间隔为10分钟。缺失的数据用-6999标记，重复记录被删除，超出物理或仪器限制的数据被删除。问题数据用红色突出显示，并保持日期和时间的一致格式。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can eddy covariance systems and scintillometers be employed to collect long-term data on energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis–desert systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪如何用于收集绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气和碳通量的长期数据。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Eddy covariance systems and scintillometers are used to acquire half-hourly turbulent flux data, including energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes. These instruments are part of a suite of observational datasets that also include auxiliary hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters, collected from multiple stations in the Heihe River Basin.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪用于获取半小时的湍流通量数据，包括能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量。这些仪器是观测数据集的一部分，此外还包括从多个站点收集的辅助水文气象、植被和土壤参数，数据来源于黑河流域。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methods are utilized to integrate hydrometeorological data with soil and vegetation parameters for comprehensive ecosystem analysis in arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，整合水文气象数据与土壤和植被参数以进行全面生态系统分析的方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Hydrometeorological data, such as radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles, along with gradients of air temperature, humidity, wind speed, and direction, are collected using automatic weather stations with 10-minute intervals. This information is supplemented with soil moisture profiles and vegetation parameters, enabling a comprehensive analysis of ecosystem dynamics in arid regions.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 水文气象数据，如辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面，以及空气温度、湿度、风速和风向的梯度，都是通过自动气象站以10分钟的间隔收集的。这些信息还补充了土壤湿度剖面和植被参数，使得对干旱地区生态系统动态的综合分析成为可能。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data collection techniques and technologies enable the comprehensive observation of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据收集技术和技术能够全面观察绿洲-沙漠系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The comprehensive observation of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems is enabled by the use of long-term datasets collected from artificial and natural systems, including half-hourly turbulent flux data acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer, as well as hydrometeorological data observed from automatic weather stations at a 10-minute average period.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 对绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的全面观察得益于从人工和自然系统收集的长期数据集，包括通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的半小时湍流通量数据，以及从自动气象站观察的10分钟平均的水文气象数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do the conditions of arid and semiarid inland river basins impact the data collection methods for monitoring ecological changes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 干旱和半干旱内陆河流流域的条件如何影响监测生态变化的数据收集方法？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The conditions of arid and semiarid inland river basins, such as ecological environment degradation and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, necessitate robust data collection methods like continuous long-term observations and the use of multiple meteorological stations to effectively monitor changes in energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 干旱和半干旱内陆河流流域的条件，如生态环境退化和频繁发生的沙尘暴，迫切需要强有力的数据收集方法，如持续的长期观测和多个气象站的使用，以有效监测能量、水汽和碳交换的变化。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways do auxiliary datasets, such as vegetation and soil parameters, enable a more detailed understanding of oasis–desert interactions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 辅助数据集，如植被和土壤参数，如何使我们对绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用有更深入的理解？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Auxiliary datasets, including vegetation and soil parameters, complement the primary data on energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, providing a more detailed understanding of oasis–desert interactions by offering insights into the ecological and physical characteristics that influence these exchanges.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 辅助数据集，包括植被和土壤参数，补充了关于能量、水蒸气和碳通量的主要数据，通过提供影响这些交换的生态和物理特征的见解，从而更详细地理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might a dataset of oasis–desert systems not achieve a comprehensive understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange interactions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么一个关于绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集可能无法全面理解能量、水汽和碳交换的相互作用？
Expectation.AnswerEn: A comprehensive understanding of these interactions in oasis–desert systems is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases. Long-term observations are indispensable to achieve this quantitative understanding.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 对绿洲-沙漠系统中这些相互作用的全面理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义。长期观察对于实现这种定量理解是不可或缺的。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise when using automatic weather stations to collect hydrometeorological data in arid and semiarid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区使用自动气象站收集水文气象数据时可能会出现哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing ecological challenges such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, which could impact the data collection process and the accuracy of the data collected by automatic weather stations.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态挑战，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，这可能会影响数据收集过程以及自动气象站收集数据的准确性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it expected that oasis–desert areas significantly impact the carbon balance of arid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么预计绿洲-沙漠地区会显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers, thereby significantly affecting the carbon balance of arid regions and playing an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 绿洲——位于半干旱地区的沙漠区域，已被之前的研究者发现是碳汇，从而显著影响了干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥着越来越重要的作用。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of using automatic weather stations in capturing comprehensive hydrometeorological data in arid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在干旱地区使用自动气象站捕捉全面水文气象数据的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Automatic weather stations are effective in capturing comprehensive hydrometeorological data as they provide consistent, high-frequency observations crucial for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems. The stations collect data such as radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, and meteorological parameters, which are indispensable for long-term studies in these regions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 自动气象站在捕捉全面的水文气象数据方面非常有效，因为它们提供了一致的、高频率的观测，这对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换至关重要。这些站点收集的数据包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面和气象参数，这些数据对于这些地区的长期研究是不可或缺的。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data from various soil temperature and moisture sensors can be effectively managed and quality-controlled in such a large-scale observation network.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白如何在如此大规模的观测网络中有效管理和质量控制来自各种土壤温度和湿度传感器的数据。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data is processed by ensuring daily 144 data points (every 10 minutes) and marking missing data with -6999. Duplicate records are removed, and any data exceeding physical or instrument limits are deleted. Questionable data is marked in red, and date and time formats are standardized.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据处理确保每天有144个数据点（每10分钟一个），缺失数据标记为-6999。重复记录被删除，任何超过物理或仪器限制的数据被删除。可疑数据用红色标记，日期和时间格式被标准化。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure how long-term observations from an oasis–desert ecosystem can contribute to addressing ecological stability and socio-economic development challenges.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定来自绿洲-沙漠生态系统的长期观察如何能帮助解决生态稳定和社会经济发展挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are crucial for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis–desert ecosystems, which helps in maintaining ecological stability, supporting sustainable development, and achieving carbon peaking and neutrality goals.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 长期观测对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换至关重要，这有助于维持生态稳定，支持可持续发展，并实现碳达峰和碳中和目标。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of the importance of having both artificial and natural systems in datasets for understanding oasis–desert interactions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解在数据集中同时拥有人工系统和自然系统对于理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用的重要性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Including both artificial and natural systems in datasets provides a comprehensive view of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, which is essential for recognizing interactions and ensuring ecological stability in oasis–desert systems.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 包括人工和自然系统在内的数据集提供了对能量、水蒸气和碳交换的全面视角，这对于识别相互作用和确保绿洲-沙漠系统的生态稳定性至关重要。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the typical data collection methods used for observing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in arid and semi-arid oasis-desert systems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn:
在干旱和半干旱绿洲-沙漠系统中，观察能量、水蒸气和碳交换的典型数据收集方法包括：

1. **气象站**：安装气象站以监测温度、湿度、风速和降水量等气象参数。
2. **土壤湿度传感器**：使用土壤湿度传感器测量土壤中的水分含量。
3. **气体交换系统**：利用开放式或闭合式气体交换系统测量植物的光合作用和呼吸作用，评估碳交换。
4. **遥感技术**：通过卫星或无人机获取地表温度、植被覆盖和土壤湿度等信息。
5. **生态系统模型**：结合现场数据和模型模拟，分析能量、水分和碳的循环过程。
6. **水文监测**：监测地下水位和地表水流动，以评估水资源的动态变化。

这些方法共同帮助研究人员理解干旱和半干旱地区的生态系统功能和气候变化影响。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Typical data collection methods in this field involve long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes using eddy covariance systems and scintillometers. Hydrometeorological data, including radiation, soil heat flux, temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles, are observed from automatic weather stations. Vegetation and soil parameters also supplement these datasets.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 该领域典型的数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪对能量、水蒸气和碳通量进行长期观测。自动气象站观测的水文气象数据包括辐射、土壤热通量、温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面。植被和土壤参数也补充了这些数据集。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please detail the challenges associated with data collection in arid and semiarid inland river basins and suggest methodological approaches to address these challenges.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请详细说明在干旱和半干旱内陆河流流域数据收集所面临的挑战，并建议解决这些挑战的方法论方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in arid and semiarid inland river basins include ecological degradation, drying rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, increased desertification, and frequent dust storms. Methodological approaches to address these challenges may involve establishing comprehensive monitoring networks and using advanced technologies such as remote sensing to enhance data accuracy and coverage.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 干旱和半干旱内陆河流流域面临的挑战包括生态退化、河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。应对这些挑战的方法论可能包括建立综合监测网络，并利用遥感等先进技术来提高数据的准确性和覆盖范围。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential strategies for expanding or refining datasets related to oasis-desert energy and carbon exchange observations.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探索与绿洲-沙漠能量和碳交换观测相关的数据集扩展或精炼的潜在策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential strategies for expanding or refining these datasets include increasing the number of observation sites, integrating additional data sources such as remote sensing and satellite data, enhancing the temporal resolution of data collection, and incorporating new technologies for measuring hydrometeorological and biophysical parameters. Collaboration with data centers to facilitate data sharing and archiving can also support dataset refinement.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 扩展或完善这些数据集的潜在策略包括增加观测站点的数量、整合额外的数据源如遥感和卫星数据、提高数据收集的时间分辨率，以及引入新技术来测量水文气象和生物物理参数。与数据中心合作以促进数据共享和归档也可以支持数据集的完善。
